5.74.text: The will to do anything comes from within yourself

10.21.text: You define your goals you map out the journey

14.11.text: In my mind comparing yourself to your competitors or anyone else

18.82.text: Should never contribute to how you define yourself?

22.78.text: But it should be used [as] is a tool to drive improvement to push yourself to make the most of every little

30.73.text: opportunity that comes your way I

35.71.text: heard a quote from Mark Cuban

38.59.text: And he said to work like someone is working 24 hours a day to take it all away from you

47.03.text: and I was giving this some thought [obviously] [it's] a powerful message and

52.19.text: I started to apply it to my own [situation] and the first thing that came to mind was running

59.63.text: It's something I do every day [a] lot of the most important decisions. I've made and ideas I've come up with have occurred while running

68.09.text: So I started to think about when I'm at my best [right] [when] I'm working out and truly pushing myself

76.94.text: Obviously, I set goals right. I look to stretch my limits my boundaries and I can do that on my own

82.30.text: [I] really don't need anyone or anything

88.73.text: Is when I feel those footsteps behind me

93.29.text: When I know that if I [don't] speed up

98.60.text: And leave me behind as they go on for a faster time and this thought drives me insane

106.26.text: Look, I know it's just to run around the charles river right? I'm downtown Boston. I'm not at the Olympics

111.59.text: [I] get why it would seem a little crazy

114.66.text: But to me, it's the same thing as a race starting a business excelling at work

119.48.text: It's instilling the mentality that I will do whatever it takes to stay ahead

127.80.text: Just like I do everything in my power to be that same [way] in all aspects of life. There are always

137.58.text: That's how I push to stay at the top of my game if you're not obsessed with getting better at doing more than everyone else

160.90.text: The sound of Footsteps is a reminder

164.56.text: That you haven't even scratched the surface of what you can do

172.15.text: How you think of winning, and that's how you will get what you want?

177.64.text: Listen every morning when you [wake] [up] you need to know that there are footsteps behind you that [a] million

187.63.text: They're waking up every day intent on doing what you do then are willing to put in the work

194.14.text: The best do that and then some right they step up. They're willing to go further be crazy

201.73.text: Put everything out there for their goals. [it] doesn't matter how ridiculous it looks

211.21.text: And I know that's vague. I know there isn't you know an answer right now in [ten] steps?

217.45.text: But you will find your way, you will stumble you'll fall

222.01.text: but if you truly have [that] tenacity

224.86.text: To outrun to outwork everyone else the only thing left to do is win

232.54.text: Surprise yourself surprise everyone around you

236.95.text: They will be there I promise
